semeval2013.d007.s000: Arsenic-tolerant microbe raises possibility of new types of life on Earth , or elsewhere
semeval2013.d007.s001: The discovery of a strange bacteria that can use arsenic as one of its nutrients widens the scope for finding new forms of life on Earth and possibly beyond .
semeval2013.d007.s002: While researchers discovered the unusual bacteria here in Earth , they say it shows that life has possibilities beyond the major elements that have been considered essential .
semeval2013.d007.s004: `` It can grow with either phosphorus or arsenic . ''
semeval2013.d007.s005: `` That makes it very peculiar , though it falls short of being some form of truly ` alien ' life , '' commented Paul C. W. Davies of Arizona State University , a co-author of the report appearing in Thursday 's online edition of the journal Science .
semeval2013.d007.s006: Six major elements have long been considered essential for life - carbon , hydrogen , nitrogen , oxygen , phosphorus and sulfur .
semeval2013.d007.s007: But the researchers found that the bacteria , discovered in Mono Lake , Calif. , is able to continue to grow after substituting arsenic for phosphorus .
semeval2013.d007.s008: `` It makes you wonder what else is possible , '' said Ariel D. Anbar of Arizona State University , a co-author of the report .
semeval2013.d007.s009: The find is important in the search for life beyond Earth because researchers need to be able to recognize life , to know what life looks like , Anbar said .
semeval2013.d007.s010: The study focuses on a microbe found on Earth .
semeval2013.d007.s011: However , the announcement of a news conference to discuss it , which did not disclose details of the find , generated widespread speculation on the Internet that the report would disclose the discovery of extraterrestrial life .
semeval2013.d007.s013: The discovery `` does show that in other planetary environments organisms might be able to use other elements to drive biochemistry and that the ` standard ' set of elements we think are absolutely necessary for life might not be so fixed , '' commented Charles Cockell , professor at Planetary and Space Sciences Research Institute , Open University , in Milton Keynes , United Kingdom .
semeval2013.d007.s014: Cockell was not part of the research team .
semeval2013.d007.s015: `` This work is novel because it shows the substitution of one element for another in fundamental biochemistry and biochemical structure , '' added Cockell .
semeval2013.d007.s016: It was n't a chance discovery .
semeval2013.d007.s017: Felisa Wolfe-Simon of NASA 's Astrobiology Institute , who led the study , targeted Mono Lake because it has high arsenic levels .
semeval2013.d007.s018: Arsenic and phosphorus are chemically similar , so she speculated that a microbe exposed to both might be able to substitute one for the other .
semeval2013.d007.s019: `` Arsenic is toxic mainly because its chemical behavior is so similar to that of phosphorus . ''
semeval2013.d007.s020: `` As a result , organisms have a hard time telling these elements apart . ''
semeval2013.d007.s021: `` But arsenic is different enough that it does n't work as well as phosphorus , so it gets in there and sort of gums up the works of our biochemical machinery , '' explained Anbar .
semeval2013.d007.s022: The researchers collected the bacteria known as GFAJ-1 and exposed it to increasing concentrations of arsenic , which it was able to adapt to and grow .
semeval2013.d007.s023: The microbe does grow better on phosphorus , but showing that it can live with arsenic instead raises the possibility that a life form using arsenic could occur naturally , either elsewhere on Earth or on another planet or moon where arsenic is more common .
semeval2013.d007.s024: Jamie S. Foster , an assistant professor of microbiology at the University of Florida , said the idea that arsenic could be substituted for phosphorus is n't new , but there has never been example where it was shown to work .
semeval2013.d007.s025: Arsenic was more common in the early times on Earth , she said , so researchers have speculated that early life forms might have used it .
semeval2013.d007.s026: `` It does suggest that that there could be other ways to form life , not just how life formed on early Earth , '' said Foster , who was not part of Wolfe-Simon 's research team .
semeval2013.d007.s027: The research was supported by NASA , the Department of Energy and the National Institutes of Health .
semeval2013.d008.s001: Support for democracy in Latin America continues to edge up , as does backing for private enterprise .
semeval2013.d008.s002: Crime has become a bigger worry than unemployment .
semeval2013.d008.s003: And Brazil is seen as more influential than the United States across much of the region .
semeval2013.d008.s004: Those are some of the findings of the latest Latinobarómetro poll taken in 18 countries and published exclusively by The Economist .
semeval2013.d008.s005: Because the poll has been taken regularly since 1995 , it tracks changes in attitude across the region .
semeval2013.d008.s006: Two related things stand out in the results of this year 's poll , taken in September and early October .
semeval2013.d008.s007: The first is Latin America 's fairly sunny mood .
semeval2013.d008.s008: The second is the increasing stability of attitudes towards democracy and its core institutions .
semeval2013.d008.s009: Support for democracy has risen noticeably in several countries on the Pacific rim of South America ( see table 1 ) .
semeval2013.d008.s010: For example in Peru , where economic growth has averaged 6 % a year since 2002 , support for democracy has risen from a low of 40 % in 2005 to 61 % this year .
semeval2013.d008.s011: It also rose in Mexico , where the economy has recovered after suffering a big drop in output last year .
semeval2013.d008.s012: But only around half of respondents in Mexico and Brazil , the region 's two most populous countries , are convinced democrats , which drags down the regional average ( see chart 2 ) .
semeval2013.d008.s013: Some 44 % of respondents across the region pronounced themselves satisfied with how their country 's democracy works in practice , the same figure as last year but a big increase on the 25 % in 2001 ( chart 3 ) .
semeval2013.d008.s014: Some 34 % said they had confidence in their country 's Congress and 45 % in their government , the same as last year in both cases but up sharply from 2003 ( 17 % and 24 % respectively ) .
semeval2013.d008.s015: A decade ago economic woes in Latin America undermined support for democracy .
semeval2013.d008.s016: That it has held up during the world financial crisis is probably because many Latin American countries suffered only a brief recession and have enjoyed a strong recovery .
semeval2013.d008.s017: In addition , a stronger social safety net has helped to shield the poor .
semeval2013.d008.s018: ( The United Nations ' Economic Commission for Latin America reported this week that the proportion of Latin Americans living in poverty rose only marginally in 2009 and has fallen again this year , to 32 % . -RRB-
semeval2013.d008.s019: But the mood varies widely from country to country ( see chart 4 ) .
semeval2013.d008.s020: Brazil 's strong economic performance and the popularity of its outgoing president , Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva , is reflected in a widely shared sense of progress .
semeval2013.d008.s021: That is scarcer in Mexico and Central America , where the recession was more severe and violent crime has worsened .
semeval2013.d008.s022: For only the second time since the polls began , more respondents across Latin America as a whole cite crime , rather than unemployment , as the most important problem facing their country ( see chart 5 ) .
semeval2013.d008.s023: Some 31 % say that either they or a close relative have been victims of crime over the past year , but that is down from 38 % last year and is the lowest figure since 1995 .
semeval2013.d008.s024: A more robust economic performance is reflected in rising support for private enterprise and the market economy : some 71 % of respondents across the region say that private enterprise is indispensable for development , up from 56 % in 2007 ( see chart 6 ) .
semeval2013.d008.s025: Some 58 % agree that the market economy is the only system that will make their country developed , up from 47 % last year .
semeval2013.d008.s026: Interestingly , 62 % of respondents in Venezuela hold that view ( and 80 % there back private enterprise ) even though their left-wing president , Hugo Chávez , is expropriating many private companies .
semeval2013.d008.s027: Brazil is the country which exercises most leadership in the region , mentioned by 19 % of respondents ( up from 18 % last year ) , followed by the United States ( 9 % , unchanged from last year ) and Venezuela ( 9 % , down from 11 % last year ) .
semeval2013.d008.s028: But the United States is seen as the most influential country by respondents in Mexico and much of Central America , whereas Venezuela enjoys that distinction in Ecuador , the Dominican Republic and Nicaragua .
semeval2013.d009.s000: Scalia and Thomas dine with healthcare law challengers as court takes case
semeval2013.d009.s001: The day the Supreme Court gathered behind closed doors to consider the politically divisive question of whether it would hear a challenge to President Obama 's healthcare law , two of its justices , Antonin Scalia and Clarence Thomas , were feted at a dinner sponsored by the law firm that will argue the case before the high court .
semeval2013.d009.s002: The occasion was last Thursday , when all nine justices met for a conference to pour over the petitions for review .
semeval2013.d009.s003: One of the cases at issue was a suit brought by 26 states challenging the sweeping healthcare overhaul passed by Congress last year , a law that has been a rallying cry for conservative activists nationwide .
semeval2013.d009.s004: The justices agreed to hear the suit ; indeed , a landmark 5.5 - hour argument is expected in March , and the outcome is likely to further roil the 2012 presidential race , which will be in full swing by the time the court 's decision is released .
semeval2013.d009.s005: The lawyer who will stand before the court and argue that the law should be thrown out is likely to be Paul Clement , who served as U.S. solicitor general during the George W. Bush administration .
semeval2013.d009.s006: Clement 's law firm , Bancroft PLLC , was one of almost two dozen firms that helped sponsor the annual dinner of the Federalist Society , a longstanding group dedicated to advocating conservative legal principles .
semeval2013.d009.s007: Another firm that sponsored the dinner , Jones Day , represents one of the trade associations that challenged the law , the National Federation of Independent Business .
semeval2013.d009.s008: Another sponsor was pharmaceutical giant Pfizer Inc , which has an enormous financial stake in the outcome of the litigation .
semeval2013.d009.s009: The dinner was held at a Washington hotel hours after the court 's conference over the case .
semeval2013.d009.s010: In attendance was , among others , Mitch McConnell , the Senate 's top Republican and an avowed opponent of the healthcare law .
semeval2013.d009.s011: The featured guests at the dinner ? Scalia and Thomas .
semeval2013.d009.s012: It 's nothing new : The two justices have been attending Federalist Society events for years .
semeval2013.d009.s013: And it 's nothing that runs afoul of ethics rules .
semeval2013.d009.s014: In fact , justices are exempt from the Code of Conduct that governs the actions of lower federal justices .
semeval2013.d009.s015: If they were , they arguably fell under code 's Canon 4C , which states , `` A judge may attend fund-raising events of law-related and other organizations although the judge may not be a speaker , a guest of honor , or featured on the program of such an event . ''
semeval2013.d009.s016: Nevertheless , the sheer proximity of Scalia and Thomas to two of the law firms in the case , as well as to a company with a massive financial interest , was enough to alarm ethics-in-government activists .
semeval2013.d009.s017: `` This stunning breach of ethics and indifference to the code belies claims by several justices that the court abides by the same rules that apply to all other federal judges , '' said Bob Edgar , the president of Common Cause .
semeval2013.d009.s018: `` The justices were wining and dining at a black-tie fundraiser with attorneys who have pending cases before the court . ''
semeval2013.d009.s019: Their appearance and assistance in fundraising for this event undercuts any claims of impartiality , and is unacceptable .
semeval2013.d009.s020: Scalia and Thomas have shown little regard for critics who say they too readily mix the business of the court with agenda-driven groups such as the Federalist Society .
semeval2013.d009.s021: And Thomas '' wife , Ginni , is a high-profile conservative activist .
semeval2013.d009.s022: Moreover , conservatives argue that it 's Justice Elena Kagan who has an ethical issue , not Scalia and Thomas .
semeval2013.d009.s023: Kagan served as solicitor general in the Obama administration when the first legal challenges to the law were brought at the trial court level .
semeval2013.d009.s024: Her critics have pushed for Kagan to recuse herself from hearing the case , saying that she was too invested in defending the law then to be impartial now .
semeval2013.d009.s025: Kagan has given no indication she will do so .

semeval2013.d011.s000: Is immigration a burden or an opportunity for the economy ?
semeval2013.d011.s001: Immigration policy under Nicolas Sarkozy was criticised from various aspects a congestion of police , legal and administrative services subjected to a policy of numbers and the compatibility of that policy with the self-proclaimed status of the country as the country of French human rights .
semeval2013.d011.s002: More recently , it is administrative harassment of foreign students , which is topical , with the minister of the interior ( `` Libération '' on 23 May ) declaring that France `` does not need foreign talent , bricklayers and waiters . ''
semeval2013.d011.s003: But it is only rarely analyzed from the economic viewpoint .
semeval2013.d011.s004: There is a lot of consensus between the Left and the Right on this subject .
semeval2013.d011.s005: On the Right , the tone was set by Jacques Chirac , who declared in 1976 that `` 900,000 unemployed would not become a problem in a country with 2 million of foreign workers , '' and on the Left by Michel Rocard explaining in 1990 that France `` can not accommodate all the world 's misery . ''
semeval2013.d011.s006: The only difference , the degree of generosity
semeval2013.d011.s007: In 2005 , the fear of invasion of the national territory by hordes of Polish plumbers was felt both on the Left and on the Right .
semeval2013.d011.s008: Both sides see immigrants as a burden on the French economy and on French society .
semeval2013.d011.s009: The only difference resides in the degree of generosity , which one deigns to grant to immigrants .
semeval2013.d011.s010: In his program , François Hollande confines himself to banalities , saying that co-development would allow our immigration problem to be solved . ''
semeval2013.d011.s011: This notion of immigration being a burden and a problem , may be an electoral asset , but it is economically very costly .
semeval2013.d011.s012: As the economists Ian Goldin and Geoffrey Cameron , remind us in a recent book summarising the most recent knowledge of immigration ( Exceptional People : How Migration Shaped Our World and Will Define Our Future , mai 2011 , Princeton University Press , 352 pp . ) , there is wide consensus among specialists on the positive impact of migration flows on economic growth , wages and employment in countries , which admit immigrants .
semeval2013.d011.s013: Restraining immigration leads to anaemic growth and harms employment .
semeval2013.d011.s014: Fears about the impact of immigrants are based on the notion that they are liable to replace native workers , in particular unskilled ones , exerting downward pressure on wages .
semeval2013.d011.s015: But experience shows that in reality immigrants are much more complementary to , rather than replacements of , local labor , exercising trades in which there is a shortage of local labor .
semeval2013.d011.s016: Unskilled immigrants work in sectors , which do not attract local labor and the most highly skilled ones in dynamic sectors where training does is not linked to offers of employment .
semeval2013.d011.s018: In the same way as a surgeon would find it difficult to work in a country with a shortage of anaesthetists , the complementarities existing between locals and immigrants bring it about that the arrival of immigrants has a positive effect on the pay of locals .
semeval2013.d011.s019: Giovanni Peri has calculated that a rise of 1 % in the migratory flow causes an increase of between 0,6 and 0,9 % in real long-term pay .
semeval2013.d011.s020: And does so without taking into account the fact that the diversity contributed by immigrants contributes to the creation of ideas and to economic growth ( a large proportion of naturalised immigrants are among American Nobel prize winners , whilst Google , Intel , Paypal , eBay and Yahoo were all founded by immigrants ) .
semeval2013.d011.s021: Migrants are also net contributors to social systems , averaging 1 % of the total budgets of European countries .
semeval2013.d011.s022: The World Labor Organisation estimates that for example in Germany , an immigrant arriving at the age of 30 , will make a net contribution ( receipts less expenditure ) of an average of 150,000 Euros to public budgets during his lifetime .
semeval2013.d011.s023: Nicolas Sarkozy wished at the start of his mandate to look for missing points of growth `` with the teeth . ''
semeval2013.d011.s024: The teeth in question , intended to serve to dissuade immigrants , had precisely the opposite effect .
semeval2013.d012.s000: Deutsche Bank pays multi-million pound fine in the USA
semeval2013.d012.s001: Fresh trouble is following hard on the heels of the uproar around Josef Ackermann , CEO of Deutsche Bank : Deutsche Bank faces a multi-million pound fine in the USA .

semeval2013.d012.s003: The issue centres on the sale of mortgage securities .
semeval2013.d012.s004: The National Credit Union Administration ( NCUA ) , a financial market regulator , accuses a string of major banks of having used false promises to mislead credit unions into buying the financial products .
semeval2013.d012.s005: The value of the securities dropped dramatically during the financial crisis and brought down the credit unions .
semeval2013.d012.s006: `` We are happy to have resolved the issue without the parties going to court , '' said a Deutsche Bank spokesman in New York .

semeval2015.d000.s005: Alimta is a powder that is made up into a solution for infusion ( drip into a vein ) .
semeval2015.d000.s006: It contains the active substance pemetrexed .
semeval2015.d000.s008: Alimta is used to treat two types of cancer : pleural mesothelioma ( cancer of the lining of the lungs that is usually caused by exposure to asbestos ) .
semeval2015.d000.s009: Alimta is used together with cisplatin ( another anticancer medicine ) when the cancer is unresectable ( cannot be removed by surgery alone ) and malignant ( has spread , or is likely to spread easily , to other parts of the body ) , in patients who have not received chemotherapy ( medicines for cancer ) before advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer that is not affecting the squamous cells .
semeval2015.d000.s010: Alimta is used in combination with cisplatin in patients who have not been treated before , and on its own in patients who have received another type of chemotherapy in the past .
semeval2015.d000.s011: The medicine can only be obtained with a prescription .
semeval2015.d000.s013: Alimta should only be given under the supervision of a doctor who is qualified in the use of anticancer chemotherapy .
semeval2015.d000.s014: The recommended dose of Alimta is 500 mg per square metre of body surface area ( calculated using the patient s height and weight ) .
semeval2015.d000.s015: It is given once every three weeks as an intravenous infusion lasting 10 minutes .
semeval2015.d000.s016: To reduce side effects , patients should take a corticosteroid and folic acid ( a type of vitamin ) , and receive injections of vitamin B12 during treatment with Alimta .
semeval2015.d000.s017: When Alimta is given with cisplatin , an anti-emetic medicine ( to prevent vomiting ) and fluids ( to prevent dehydration ) should also be given before or after the cisplatin dose .
semeval2015.d000.s018: Treatment should be delayed or discontinued , or the dose reduced , in patients whose blood counts are abnormal or who have certain other side effects .
semeval2015.d000.s019: Alimta is not recommended for use in patients with moderate or severe kidney problems .
semeval2015.d000.s020: For more information , see the Summary of Product Characteristics ( also part of the EPAR ) .
semeval2015.d000.s022: The active substance in Alimta , pemetrexed , is a cytotoxic medicine ( a medicine that kills cells that are dividing , such as cancer cells ) , which belongs to the group antimetabolites .
semeval2015.d000.s023: In the body , pemetrexed is converted into an active form that blocks the activity of the enzymes that are involved in producing nucleotides ( the building blocks of DNA and RNA , the genetic material of cells ) .
semeval2015.d000.s025: For the treatment of malignant pleural mesothelioma , Alimta has been studied in one main study in 456 patients who had not received chemotherapy for their disease before .
semeval2015.d000.s026: The effects of Alimta in combination with cisplatin were compared with those of cisplatin alone .
semeval2015.d000.s027: For the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer , the effects of Alimta were compared with those of docetaxel ( another anticancer medicine ) in one study involving 571 patients with locally advanced or metastatic disease who had received chemotherapy in the past .
semeval2015.d000.s028: Alimta was also compared with gemcitabine ( another anticancer medicine ) , both in combination with cisplatin , in a study involving 1,725 patients who had not received chemotherapy for lung cancer in the past .
semeval2015.d000.s029: In all three studies , the main measure of effectiveness was how long the patients survived .
semeval2015.d000.s030: What benefit has Alimta shown during the studies ?
semeval2015.d000.s031: Alimta increased the survival time of patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma .
semeval2015.d000.s032: Patients receiving Alimta and cisplatin survived for an average of 12.1 months , compared with 9.3 months in those receiving cisplatin alone .
semeval2015.d000.s033: In the treatment of patients with non-small cell lung cancer , Alimta was as effective as the comparators .
semeval2015.d000.s034: In patients who had received chemotherapy in the past , the average survival time was 8.3 months with Alimta , compared with 7.9 months with docetaxel .
semeval2015.d000.s035: In patients who had not received chemotherapy in the past , the average survival time was 10.3 months in both groups .
semeval2015.d000.s036: However , in both studies , patients whose cancer was not affecting squamous cells had longer survival times if they received Alimta than if they received the comparator .
semeval2015.d000.s037: In contrast , patients whose cancer was affecting squamous cells had shorter survival times if they received Alimta .

semeval2015.d003.s003: Cerenia contains the active substance maropitant and is available as tablet or as solution for injection .
semeval2015.d003.s004: The tablets are pale-orange and have a score line on both sides so that they can be halved .
semeval2015.d003.s005: Each tablet is marked with the Pfizer logo on one side and with the letters MPT and the quantity of maropitant on the other side .
semeval2015.d003.s007: Cerenia is an anti-emetic , this means that it stops vomiting .
semeval2015.d003.s008: It is used in dogs to prevent vomiting such as vomiting caused by chemotherapy ( medicines used for the treatment of cancer , some of which are known to cause vomiting ) .
semeval2015.d003.s009: In combination with supportive measures such as other veterinary treatment or a special diet , Cerenia can also be used in the treatment of vomiting ( either as injection or as injection followed by tablets ) .
semeval2015.d003.s010: For these purposes , Cerenia can be given for up to five days
semeval2015.d003.s012: Cerenia blocks a neurokinin 1 ( NK1 ) receptor , which acts in the central nervous system .
semeval2015.d003.s014: A large number of studies with Cerenia were carried out either in laboratory dogs or in animal patients at veterinary practises in several European countries and in the USA .
semeval2015.d003.s015: What benefit has Cerenia shown during the studies ?
semeval2015.d003.s016: The results of the studies showed that Cerenia was more effective than the placebo : less vomiting was seen in dogs that received the medicine than in dogs that received a placebo , both in the treatment or in the prevention of vomiting .
semeval2015.d003.s017: The treatment of a vomiting dog should be started with the injection , since vomiting animals might not be able to keep a tablet down ( as they might throw the intact tablet up again ) .
semeval2015.d003.s018: For follow-up treatment , the animal owner can administer the tablets to the dog .
semeval2015.d003.s019: Also , the treatment of vomiting should only be together with other supportive measure or other veterinary therapy while addressing the underlying causes of the vomiting .
semeval2015.d003.s020: What is the risk associated with Cerenia ?
semeval2015.d003.s021: Cerenia was generally well tolerated when administered daily at dosages up to 5 times the recommended doses for an extended period of time ( up to 3 times the recommended maximum duration of treatment ) .
semeval2015.d003.s022: What are the precautions for the person who gives the medicine or comes into contact with the animal ?
semeval2015.d003.s023: Cerenia does not represent a particular risk for people .
